DataElement.preferredName: Hematology Serum Creatinine Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of serum creatinine in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Examination of blood for Creatinine,  a constituent of muscle tissue, which is used to evaluate kidney glomerular filtration. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/28/12 - DEC released as it is being reused by other NHLBI projects.  2/9/12 - Retired as part of content cleanup activities per concurrence with Jenny Larkin (NHLBI).  8/2/07-DEC released per FBPP review team direction. Per MC, this DEC has been changed back to Released as our team reuses this DEC. AK 2/27/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
